article.title: A High-Resolution Multiband Survey of Westerlund 2 With the Hubble Space Telescope. III. The present-day stellar mass function

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Table 1, what is the mean stellar surface density per pixel (in units of stars per pixel) for the F814W filter?
Figure 1 illustrates the completeness distribution for the four wide band filters.  Which of the following statements is supported by this figure?
choices: The 50% completeness limit is reached at a brighter magnitude for F160W compared to F125W.
The 75% completeness limit is reached at a fainter magnitude for F555W compared to F814W.
The completeness levels remain constant regardless of magnitude for all filters.
The F555W filter allows for a deeper observation than the F160W filter.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 7 shows the present-day mass function (PDMF) of Westerlund 2. What is the key implication of the difference in slopes between the PDMF for all stars (black solid line) and the PDMF for only main-sequence stars (red solid line)?
choices: The cluster exhibits mass segregation, with more massive stars concentrated towards the center.
The cluster is very young, and many stars haven\'t reached the main sequence yet.
There is a significant population of unresolved binary stars in the cluster.
The IMF of Westerlund 2 is fundamentally different from the typical Salpeter IMF.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on the analysis of the red tail stars in Section 4.3 and Figure 5, what is the most likely location of the molecular cloud observed in Spitzer IRAC data relative to Westerlund 2?
choices: At the same distance as Westerlund 2, but not directly along the line of sight.
The location cannot be determined from the available data.
